author: {'steamid': '76561198003919468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1696121409}
review:
nearly a good quiz game.
like the idea. great voice over but with out much funny material. the timers combined with A high level of voice over skill that lack joke content soon becomes abrasive and annoying! the way the questions are written combined with the all out emphasis narration mean that its not so much the question your figuring out but what the hell he trying to say in the 1st place. so if i dont want to hear the 'right' answer where is the skip button? also the films didnt seem that relevant to me, for eg you know what my good friend jack burton always says about the eye of the storm?? open yr eyes and watch some GOOD movies, gone with the wind SUCKS and i am happy not  to know shit about it or its boring friends.SKIP BUTTON!. Over all i found my answers to be, dont care or shut the hell up already!
pretty glad i dont know about alot of these film tbh.

couldve been good if they..
watched some better movies.
wrote some gags and stuff
it wasnt a bitchy nag (like 25% less)
S-K-I-P   B-U-T-T-O-N!!
And why the hell put A timer on category selection? (this ended the fun for me!) 

it would be good to see these more inventive selections, it seems that they are mostly what the jibberish vs fact premise derives from, why limit the introduction to the subject matter, let us take it on before you slag us out the door with a gob barrage of pebble dash shrapnel! iam not having problems jumping out of a plane here, IAM JUST SELECTING!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042406453', 'num_games_owned': 1063, 'num_reviews': 752, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1676236485}
review:
[quote]For more puzzle game reviews, news and everything puzzle-related, follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/25928931-Puzzle-Lovers/]Puzzle Lovers[/url] and check out our [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/puzzlelovers]Steam group[/url].[/quote]

[b]you don't know jack[/b] is the best trivia game series of all time. this one is from 1997, so it's pretty outdated by now and [b]it's always been us-centric[/b] (though with movies both are less of an issue than in other entries), so you'll either find it very challenging or very frustrating if you're from somewhere else. or a piece of cake because you know all the answers.

it's your typical multiple choice deal, but there are [b]a ton of other question types over the series[/b], like dis or dat (or sometimes both) or gibberish question. you can play a game of [b]7 or 21 questions[/b], some question types only appear in the full run, but they both end with the [b]jack attack[/b]. there's a clue and you have to match things accordingly.

[b]local multiplayer is available for up to 3 players[/b], you can even screw each other by buzzing in and forcing another player to answer. save for a few occasions way back when, I've always played it alone and always had a blast.

it's all [b]presented as a tv show[/b] (there was an actual short-lived tv show as well, should be on youtube), there's some behind-the-scenes chatter at the beginning, fake commercials at the end (don't you dare skip them!), fake money to win and all that, and [b]the writing is fantastic[/b]. if it was a simple text-based thing, it'd still be excellent stuff, so much creativity, but [b]the voiceovers take it to a whole new level[/b]. lots of characters, one-off or recurring, great hosts, also one-off or recurring, and again, the whole thing is just great.

[b]the attention to detail and variety elevates it even further.[/b] sure, if you play long enough, you'll see repeated questions (though I don't think the game will show them again until you've seen most of them), but there are a lot of different ways to introduce questions, a lot of remarks if you chose the wrong answer or hesitate to enter your name (in which case the host will give you one) or pick a category or answer, a relevant joke for most choices, right or wrong, and of course the commercials, man... the game also starts differently based on the time and date, so on certain holidays, early in the morning, late at night, on friday evening, and so on. and for answers that need typing, you can try some profanities, see what good they do.

[b]there was nothing done to modernize the game[/b] for the steam release, so it runs in 640x480 (a very tiny window with a black background, you can set the .exe to run in that resolution or something closer and fill the screen more with the actual game), there's no steam overlay, there's only a single volume setting (it's fine in this case, though lowering it completely didn't let me raise it again until a restart) and controls aren't rebindable. each player gets a buzz hotkey scattered on the keyboard, the screw is the same for everybody, and if you play alone, no need to buzz and space works just fine for that too.

I literally don't know jack and I've been having fun with the series since it first came out, most of it played alone. if you don't mind questions about older stuff (or that's your specialty) and can handle a lower resolution, definitely pick these up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140622478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1709930033}
review: This is another fun entry in the YDKJ series although the themed entries such as this one along with SPORTS and TELEVISION is pretty difficult so you do have to be pretty knowledgeable in movies to be consistently good in this. It is outdated but still enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169235574', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1704058584}
review: First things first: this game came out in 1997 so don't expect any Avengers or Harry Potter related questions. But also with that in mind, some of the questions seem out of date as most of them referenced movies from the 70ies and 80ies with only a very few 90ies mixed in. As usual the gameplay is fun and the prompts are wonderfully silly, just be prepared to be frustrated if your movie knowledge doesn't include qa vast knowledge of the classics and their personnel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800965012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1630885600}
review:
Do I recommend this game? No. 
However, I think the page is honest about what type of game this is, so if it seems appealing, by all means go ahead and get this.

Like lots of others, I got this as part of a bundle, and perhaps never would have played it otherwise.

The most important point to note is that this game is from 1997. So all of the trivia is from movies from before this date. Some of the questions just seemed ridiculous, I'd be surprised if anyone knew the answer (again, it's labelled as a challenging game, the developers are up-front about this).

However, when compared to the Jackbox games, this one pales in comparison. It's basic quiz game with very specific movie references that hasn't aged well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259831834', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1606878216}
review:
I bought this game for 1$ on sale so I really don't mind it.
However, this game does not hold up well at all, questions are pretty much blind guesses 3/4 times because of how old and random the movies are. The game doesn't even have a settings page, so your stuck watching it on a tiny little box in the middle of your screen, which there is a workaround but its not even worth the effort. 
I personally think this game is dead and doesn't need to be played, it had its run when it was released but now it just doesn't compare to any of the other amazing Jackbox games. 
(NOTE: You can not play this with people who aren't watching the game in person, there is no jackbox.tv compatibility.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1532, 'num_reviews': 875, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1579128688}
review:
[h1]YOU DON`T KNOW ENGLISCH MOVIES![/h1]

Die Spielreihe kam urspr√ºnglich f√ºr die Playstation 1 raus und wurde nun, Jahre sp√§ter, auf Steam ver√∂ffentlicht. Der Daumen geht nach oben, aber bitte das ganze Review lesen, welches stellvertretend f√ºr die gesamte Spielereihe steht!

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Die gesamte ‚ÄúYOU DON`T KNOW JACK‚Äù ‚Äì Reihe ist ein Quizspiel, die sich durch abstrakte Fragen und viel Humor auszeichnet. Man kann ausw√§hlen, ob man alleine oder im Partymodus spielen will und bekommt anschlie√üend 7 oder 21 Fragen gestellt, wobei man aus einer von drei fragw√ºrdigen Kategorien ausw√§hlen darf. Wer den ‚ÄûBuzzer‚Äú dr√ºckt, darf antworten: Ist es Richtig, gibt es die Summe aufs Konto, ansonsten wird sie abgezogen.  Gelegentlich gibt es dann noch Zusatzspiele, wo man Begriffe assoziieren muss und √Ñhnliches. 

[b]Story[/b]
Klar, das Spiel ist eine Quizshow und hat damit keine Geschichte. Allerdings sind die vertonten Stimmen einfach der Hammer und rei√üen st√§ndig sehr geile Witze. Am Ende gibt es auch verst√∂rende und lustige Werbeclips zum Anh√∂ren. Auch die Kategorien sind ziemlich durchgeknallt und die Fragen werden manchmal so merkw√ºrdig und verzweigt gestellt, dass man erstmal √ºberhaupt die Frage herausarbeiten muss. Zudem beinhaltet das Spiel oft Fremdw√∂rter oder √§ltere politische Themen. Hier liegt aber das gro√üe Problem: Das Spiel ist nur auf Englisch verf√ºgbar! Normalerweise keine gro√üe Sache, jedoch werden wie bereits erw√§hnt, viele Fremdw√∂rter benutzt, die man sich auch schon schwer ins Deutsche √ºbersetzen kann und dann noch selten wei√ü, was eigentlich gemeint ist. Zudem zielen geschichtliche, gesellschaftliche und politische Fragen auf die USA ab und nicht wie in meiner Playstationfassung, auf die Deutsche.

[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
Die Aufl√∂sung ist leider nicht einfach so skalierbar, wodurch das Spiel nur in einem kleinen Fenster ge√∂ffnet wird. Ansonsten ist das Spiel grafisch nicht aufwendig, da es zum Einen sehr alt und zum Anderen eben ein Quizspiel ist.
Die Musik klingt sehr flockig nach einer typischen Quizshow und die Vertonung ist in der englischen Version und damals auch in der Deutschen einfach super gewesen.

[b]Fazit[/b]
‚ÄûYOU DON`T KNOW JACK‚Äú ist ein super Spiel, was mich fr√ºher auf der Playstation st√§ndig zum Lachen gebracht hat. Leider wurde die Steamversion nur auf Englisch ver√∂ffentlicht und ich habe wirklich fast alles versucht. Ich habe die deutsche Vertonung im Internet gesucht und habe die Entwickler angeschrieben, jedoch ohne Erfolg. Den ersten Teil kann man allerdings nachgebaut im Browser spielen, den Link werde ich aber hier logischerweise nicht ver√∂ffentlichen.  Auf jeden Fall Danke an diesem Typen, dass er ein super Spiel nachgebaut hat. Wer wirklich gut im Englischen ist, kann sich die Spielreihe gerne anschaffen, ansonsten w√ºrde ich stark davon abraten.


Hat dir das Review gefallen? Dann folge mir doch in meiner [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool]Steamgruppe[/url], wo ich meine Reviews als Kurator verfasse.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988931399', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1693780192}
review:
My personal favorite of the classic YDKJ games, the Movies edition has an excellent variety of questions, great voice work, and for its age plays pretty well on modern systems. However, it's important to note that this was released in 1997 with no content updates made, so to really enjoy this you need some familiarity with American movies and performers of that era and then going back to roughly 1940. There's good humor and lame humor, easy questions and ones out of left field, but on the whole it's still quite fun and I play this at least a couple times each year.

4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198050307392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1533497514}
review:
The interface is fine, the graphics are fine, its the questions that were terrible. I would have liked to see questions centered on classic films, or blockbusters, or important films. Instead you would have to know two out of three of the following: who was the star of a Doctor Pepper add from the mid seventies, what his line was, and another movie that he was in. 
Quite dissappointed. Second round was played with older people  ( they did just as poorly as I did)

author: {'steamid': '76561198149993698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1561718719}
review:
[System used - Win 10; 1070GTX, Gaming rig and Win10 HP 8mb ram laptop with 2GB dedicated graphics]
I have always liked the "You don't know Jack" games - having played them since their first incarnation many window platforms ago.  They can lose their magic a little because they follow the same formula, but it's bit like having different trivial pursuit games, enough different topics and a bit of fun to play with someone else, or by yourself.  

As I am from Australia the only downside is that there is a lot of content that is not relevant or is specific to US (eg: some comedy and tv shows that may not be shown here), although if you have a good general kinowledge of movies then this is only a very minor criticism.  I would like to see some Oz movies included of course.  Note that I have played this game a lot more than the 2 hours it says on my steam account.

Recommended for those who have a good knowledge of movies, enjoy other "Jack" games and get on sale.
My rating is 6/10 overall for gameplay.  
(note I use ratings where anything above 5 is ok to excellent)

author: {'steamid': '76561198077900189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1617571244}
review: Similar to You Don't Know Jack Sports, this iteration of the franchise deals exclusively with Film trivia.  Most of what I said in my YDKJ Sports review can be applied here, just change "sports" to "movies."  Movie buffs will get the most out of this; comedy will be the saving grace for everyone else.  Again, I think it would be prudent to purchase this in the bundle, and that's where my recommendation falls.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991367479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1479470443}
review:
Hm, how should I put this? I hate it. 
So, I liked the first few You Don't Know Jack games in my youth, and always felt that they posed interesting questions paired with good humor, even when I was younger. 
I also love movies and have watched several thousand, so this should be good for me, right?
Uh, no. I've read some people's complaints on here about the interface, and they are plain wrong. It's fine, aside from not adjusting to resolutions above 1024x768, doesn't really matter. 
The real problem is the obscurity of the questions. 
As an example, I played a random 21 questions game, and in order to finish the game with a score above ZERO, the winning player would have to be intimately familiar with:
Our Man Flint
Reality Bites
Song of the South
She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
Myra Breckenridge
all of the seven dwarf's names
most titles of Jerry Lewis' filmography
and NO ONE I was playing with got a score over ZERO. So, yeah, fun game, maybe, if you're Leonard Maltin, and you're playing with Gene Shalit and Ken Jennings. But even for the average movie buff, let alone the average person, this is just silly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040884867', 'num_games_owned': 2433, 'num_reviews': 901, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1387423553}
review:
[b]Until recently (ie. [i]Quiplash[/i], and the party box 2), [i]JackBox[/i] had a great formula and unique party-game style BUT there were [i]terrible[/i] control options and they all felt like a bad port.[/b]

I'd pass on all of the older [i]You Don't Know Jack[/i] titles and go for the more modern [i]JackBox[/i] games that let people use mobile devices as the controllers. 

Bottom line: great ideas and fun here, but terrible interface, controls, and overal wasted potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109641005', 'num_games_owned': 951, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1490637821}
review: Simple fun from the 90s. I'm a trivia buff, so this was right up my ally. Not to mention, the stupid humor (I use stupid in a positive way here) is quite refreshing and enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119765006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1439412363}
review: The game is fun, and definitely follows the YDKJ pattern, but the movie trivia does become only more dated and obscure with time, as even what were newer movies when the game was made are now decades old. Even if you're really into movies, you will still be lucky to get more than a handful of correct answers in a full game, despite the impression caused by the screenshots. This is especially true if you don't watch and rewatch classic films and the popular movies from the 70s, 80s, and 90s on a regular basis. It's still very good, and I definitely look forward to playing the multiplayer and hopefully letting others narrow down the answers a bit for me sometimes, but it seems fair to warn everyone that this is not the type of trivia game where one can reasonably expect to be really "good" at it. If you cannot have fun while being utterly clueless and guessing the wrong answers to silly questions, you will despise the game very quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043346855', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 630, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1504932297}
review: Hosted by Cookie - and you can never have too much Cookie.  Based on the YDKJ 2 engine with some very inspired new assets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162051946', 'num_games_owned': 1241, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1433139346}
review: I would have to say that im  disappointed in this game. I usually enjoy trivia games. But never played a You Don't know Jack Games. The main problem i have with the game is the way the questions are asked. Instead of simply asking you who directed this and who was in that or what scene is this from. It has to ask you question in some nonsensical way. like "In the movie Airplane, Jimmy is asked if he has seen a grown man naked. Who would he see naked in the directors other movies". Its actually a trick question since that movie had 3 directors.  Also i got really annoyed by the narrator constant sarcasm. That alone gives me a reason not to play this again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066830407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1680989042}
review:
Embarrassing admission: when I was in middle school, I had a crush on Cookie.

I've still got the game disk (and instruction manual!) for this kicking around somewhere, though I haven't been able to actually run it on a computer since about 2005. I bought the bundle pretty much the instant I saw that, at long last, the YDKJ games were available on Steam (well, some of them).

YDKJ Movies was tough when I played it when it first came out, because I was pretty young and hadn't seen that many movies. Now it's still really tough, because the majority of movies I've seen came out since 1997 (or at least are fresher in my memory). I'm pretty good at trivia, so I never found any of the other YDKJ games difficult, but this one's still rough. Still, the humor and nostalgia more than make up for it, and getting questions wrong just means more opportunities for Cookie to hilariously insult me. I don't even mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035643084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1576881548}
review:
From MST3K to the Big Silver Screen at AMC or any other Movie Theater, YDKJ Movies is a pretty good CD-ROM Cinema Triva/Digital Download Game. Don't forget the Popcorn, Candy & Snacks before you take your seat in your Local Movie Theaters, New Releases or Classic Movies.

YDKJ Movies is also one of the first YDKJ games to be published by Sierra On-Line as well, following Sierra On-Line's purchase of Berkeley Systems in 1997 until Berkeley Systems' final published game: YDKJ Louder Faster Funnier in 2000 before Berkeley Systems' closure in 2001.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010313742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1442806247}
review: I've loved this game and the original one since it came out back in 1997, so it is awesome that Steam has it available.  I could play my original disc version, but Win 7 doesn't like Windows 3.1/95 games.  This have never been an easy game series to master.  The questions are often time quite difficult, and crazy (but that's the fun of it all).  It would have been nice it the host, Cookie, had continued through into the rest of the games, but he stepped down for another actor after this outting.  Everything about the first three Jack games are great.  The humor, the setting, the difficulty (which can piss you off at times since you come away saying to yourself, "Crap!  I knew that!  Why didn't I choose that answer!?"  Even the credits are hilarious with the fake commercials.  If you love quirky, fun and challenging trivia games, don't miss this or Volumes 1 (the Xtra Larged Edition) and 2, the Volume 4 - The Ride.  Skip Volume 3.  It got bad reviews back when it was first released.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993624971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1709864455}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985209709', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1387508863}
review:
This is one of the best video game franchises in history, just because it actually requires you to know things. As in, really know them. You can't just be all "oh, I like movies" and expect to get by in this game. You have to activate your brain and fork out hard facts about really tough Hollywood jive. 

Get this game if you want to both be intellectually stimulated and humiliated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047489380', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1387775617}
review: The title says it all, when you play you really do find out you don't know jack about movies. The game was obviously made quite a while ago without HD resolutions in mind and it's definitely not a game for kids with all the adult humor which was definitely a good thing in my situation. This has made a great addition to my party game line-up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970721201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1667016144}
review:
This game is really for hardcore movie buffs. I've watched probably close to 3000 movies in 3 decades but this particular YDKJ game is still quite hard. I wouldn't recommend it to a casual player, more for the super hardcore quiz / movie buffs.

On a note to the game itself, I'm pretty disappointed. There is no option to play full screen, no choice of screen resolution or similar. Looks crappy, it's a old game and to be expected. The commentator is funny for the most part but sometimes I'd rather just play than to listen to him.

Hate the fact that you always have to watch the intro which takes like a minute until you can actually play. There should be an option to skip the intro.

Verdict: Good value game for hardcore quiz (movie) buffs. Terrible integration on steam as in no achievements, no nothing, no option for screen resolution etc. The "Millionaire" games may be better suited for the casual player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038479815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1684175295}
review:
Deutsche YOU DON'T KNOW JACK Fans fragen sich vielleicht, ob sich der Kauf dieses Ablegers lohnt. W√§hrend es in den 90ern einige Teile mit liebevoller Synchronisation zu uns geschafft haben, blieben und dieses Filmquiz und einige andere leider verwehrt. Dank Steam kann man sie nun f√ºr kleines Geld nachholen, und das hat mich pers√∂nlich sehr gefreut, weil ich sogar schon mit dem Gedanken gespielt hatte, sie zu importieren. So ist es nat√ºrlich bequemer.

Nur wie spielt sich YDKJ ohne deutsche Synchro? Normalerweise ist das tats√§chlich ein Problem, denn es geht nicht nur um das blo√üe Verst√§ndnis, sondern auch um das Hintergrundwissen. Die Spiele beziehen sich gerne auf amerikanische Eigenarten, wer sich also nicht mit Footballteams, TV Sternchen und typischen Speisen auskennt, wird bestimmte Fragen trotz besten Sprachkenntnissen nicht beantworten k√∂nnen. Hier punktet das Filmquiz, denn Hollywoodfilme sind ein internationales Thema. In meinen bisherigen Runden gab es keine Frage, die mich frustriert denken lie√ü: "Das kann man aber nur als Amerikaner wissen!". Man kann dieses Spiel also guten Gewissens auch deutschen Spielern empfehlen, die sich Sorgen machen, ob die Fragen zu schwer sind.

Allerdings gibt es auch einen kleinen Nachteil: Da es sich tats√§chlich um reine Filmfragen handelt, f√ºhlt sich das Spiel weniger chaotisch an als die YDKJ Titel mit gemischten Inhalten. Wer aber einfach nur auf der Suche nach einem lustig pr√§sentiertem Filmquiz ist, bei dem man ein wenig um die Ecke denken muss, der wird seinen Spa√ü haben. Das typische Jack-Feeling kommt auch hierbei auf.
